# I collect here my favourite facts encountered in various museums, experiences, books, or from people etc.


## Row

::: {.card fill=false expandable="false"}
A significant fraction of Earth’s water likely formed before the Sun, originating in interstellar space, although not all of it predates the Solar System.
:::


::: {.card fill=false expandable="false"}
Neither animal nor fungus, the blob (*Physarum polycephalum*) can solve shortest-path problems by optimizing nutrient networks.
:::

::: {.card fill=false expandable="false"}
A lot of animals have roughly the same number of heartbeats over a lifetime. Of course, many species (including humans and birds) do not follow it.
:::

::: {.card fill=false expandable="false"}
One of the earliest British historical heroes is Boudica, a woman who led a major rebellion against Roman rule in the 1st century CE.
:::

## Row

::: {.card fill=false expandable="false"}

:::

::: {.card fill=false expandable="false"}
Bluetooth technology is named after Harald “Bluetooth” Gormsson, a Viking king who unified Denmark and Norway.
:::

::: {.card fill=false expandable="false"}
During the last Ice Age, megafauna included giant ground sloths that lived across the Americas until around 10,000 years ago.
:::
